com.thomsonreuters.upa.perftools.upajtransportperf

Class TransportChannelHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.upa.perftools.upajtransportperf.TransportChannelHandler

  • public class TransportChannelHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs the associated with setting up and using UPA Transport Channels, such as initializing channels, reading, flushing, and checking ping timeouts.

      • addChannel

        public ClientChannelInfo addChannel(com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Channel channel,
                                    boolean checkPings)
        Adds a connected or accepted channel to the ChannelHandler.
        Parameters:
        channel - - connected or accepted channel
        checkPings - - flag to check pings or not
        Returns:
        client channel information for the connected or accepted channel

      • readChannel

        public boolean readChannel(ClientChannelInfo channelInfo,
                           long stopTimeNsec,
                           com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        read data from channels until stopTimeNsec is reached.
        Parameters:
        channelInfo - - channel information
        stopTimeNsec - - stop time in nano seconds. (stopTimeNsec should be based on System.nanoTime()).
        error - Gives detailed information about error if any occurred during socket operations.
        Returns:
        true if data is read.

      • readChannels

        public int readChannels(long stopTimeNsec,
                        com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Tries to read data from channels until stopTimeNsec is reached(stopTimeNsec should be based on System.nanoTime()). Also initializes any new channels.
        Parameters:
        stopTimeNsec - - stop time in nano seconds
        error - Gives detailed information about error if any occurred during socket operations.
        Returns:
        negative value in case of error, >=0 if no errors.

      • initializeChannel

        public int initializeChannel(ClientChannelInfo clientChannelInfo,
                             com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Try to initialize a single channel.
        Parameters:
        clientChannelInfo - - client channel information
        error - Gives detailed information about error if any occurred during socket operations.
        Returns:
        negative value in case of error, >=0 if no errors.

      • waitForChannelInit

        public int waitForChannelInit(ClientChannelInfo clientChannelInfo,
                              int waitTimeMilliSec,
                              com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Attempts initialization on the given channel for the specified period of time.
        Parameters:
        clientChannelInfo - - client channel info
        waitTimeMilliSec - - wait time in milli seconds to try initialize channel
        error - - error information populated when error occurs
        Returns:
        < 0 if there is any error, TransportReturnCodes.CHAN_INIT_IN_PROGRESS (2) if channel initialization in progress

      • checkPings

        public int checkPings()
        Performs ping timeout checks for channels in this channel handler.

      • requestFlush

        public void requestFlush(ClientChannelInfo clientChannelInfo)
        Requests that the ChannelHandler begin calling upa flush() for a channel. Used when a call to upa write() indicates there is still data to be written to the network.
        Parameters:
        clientChannelInfo -

      • transportThread

        public TransportThread transportThread()
        Returns:
        Provider thread for the channel handler

      • activeChannelList

        public java.util.Queue<ClientChannelInfo> activeChannelList()
        Returns:
        List of channels that are active.

      • initializingChannelList
